data.title: Great food
data.text: This is great local restaurant in Eagan!  The hummus place was delicious .  I also recommend the turkey burger and gypsy sangria.  We brought the kids and there were good options in the kids menu as well.

data.title: Charming setting
data.text:
All of the reviews are based on one's subjective opinion. I'm sure there are those who really enjoy this restaurant. The food was good but not exceptional. A bit over priced but not to the extent that should discourage one from try dinning at the Mason Jar.

Give the Mason Jar a try and be sure to sample one of the many cupcakes.

data.title: Cute but overpriced for what you get
data.text: Servers need more training. Ours couldn't tell us about a dish served. Cupcakes in bakery are small and overpriced. Quaint decor, but we didn't find it worth returning.

data.title: Service interaction - total fail ...
data.text: Food & atmosphere: worth a trip but the service experience was a real bummer ... 9/10/16: we were a group of 3 women friends for the purpose of coffee/Saturday breakfast/catching up. Server reluctantly offered us 1 coffee refill, after that only upon request. After clearing our plates, delivering our bills & stopping back to get payment (clearly unhappy we hadn't loaded our credit cards into the folders yet...) she explained to us they had "reservations coming in" & would like us to leave - she suggested a move to the Cupcake/bakery area if we wanted to stay. (I'm actually very sensitive to overstaying my time in a restaurant always watching whether they are busy, with anyone waiting.) Neither of which was the case, always tables open / no lines during our entire time there. What a complete customer service fail on her part: at that moment all of us vowed we'd never return. The energy created by this one (unnecessary) interaction was so unfortunate ... amazing how a single exchange can do that. Msg to management: customers are important: they remember the spirit of a place, often more than the food.

data.title: Best Desserts Around!
data.text: My husband and I stopped at Cupcake and The Mason Jar this evening, and oh my goodness is all I can say! I highly recommend the Lemon Strawberry Bar, the Chocolate Peanut Butter Bar, the Lemon Sunshine cupcake and the Watch Out For Caramel (?) cupcake. So delicious!

data.title: Great Breakfast, Awesome Cupcakes
data.text: I had the MJ Omelet, which is a pot roast omelet with the rosemary roasted potatoes. It was wonderful. My friend had the veggie burger and raved about it.  The breakfast menu has mostly pork for the meat items, so be aware if you have dietary restrictions. When we left, we grabbed some cupcakes. The Latte cupcake was good, but the Kahlua cupcake is worth coming back for.

data.title: Disappointing Experience
data.text: I went to the Mason Jar during my lunch hour at work. The hostess/waitress that seated me said that I could order breakfast.  She handed me a breakfast/lunch menu but then asked me what I wanted for breakfast. I chose a pot roast omelet with country potatoes ($14).  There was very little meat in the omelet and the potatoes were over done.  It took quite awhile to get my check and I had to go get her to pay. On the way out I decided to purchase a dozen mini cupcakes.  $17.50 for them was very high priced!  The person behind the counter was short with me and rude.  I will never go back.

data.title: Brunch
data.text:
A few tips for you, 

The mini mason jars for water should be cleaned better!!!!!! The rims are so disgusting, they look like they've been never washed! 

First time we visited on a Sunday AM,  we had a wonderful server. Second time also on a Sunday AM (a much younger one) not so much. Service and front entrance greeting is something they should really work on. Oh The hostess ! 😩

On both occasions  and on different tables, my food got really cold because I we sat underneath an air vent. 

The cupcake place? Not buying any! First, the people behind the counter are not knowledgeable, second they are dry and too cold and third they run out of flavors by 11 am!!!!! 

For a positive review, the huevos rancheros are really good. 

I will give this place another try. Will keep u posted.

data.title: Nice option for breakfast
data.text: Very cute place, mason jars (of course) hanging everywhere and fun accents. Tried it for breakfast and were very pleased with the M.J. Omelet.  It was eggs with pot roast, caramelized onions, mushrooms and cheddar cheese.  More than enough to split. Other items looked good as well. I'd go back to check out the other items on the menu.  A bit noisy but nice.

data.title: Great food, nice location
data.text: We ate dinner there and it was very good.  Not your usual bar food, and some very good home style food selections.  They make a blueberry-basil spritzer that you can add vodka to, that was really good on a hot summer night.  I'll try it again and update my review.

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: Great food and the setting is very nice. They have a nice patio of you're visiting on a nice day. I really like this place because the servers are very friendly and it's reasonably priced. I would definitely recommend this place!

data.title: Last minute decision
data.text: Went for last minute dinner with friends. Friendly greeting, great service. Menu variety was great. One person needed gluten free and there is great selection available.

data.title: I was excited to visit, left disappointed.
data.text: Family and I visited the Mason jar in July in search of a great pot pie. I had heard it's one of the best. The atmosphere was casual, the table we were set at had no air conditioning. The waitress said we're on the backside of the kitchen and the air conditioning is way on the other side, it was a sweat fest. I think the food was average. I couldn't cut through my pot pie because the flaky top was too hard. I did get a replacement top, but that wasn't much better. Mac & cheese was average. You get a feel from presentation and taste that I maybe cut them on a bad day. I think it's worth trying again.

data.title: Sundy brunch
data.text: Went here after church for a sandwich, with my wife, two daughters and three grandchildren.  We were seated promptly, but it was awhile for a waitress to come to the table.  Ordered some Bloody Mary's and a second one later, as they were only $5 each.  Danielle was our server.  Separate tickets and our meal consisted of the MJ Burger and the Breakfast Quesadilla, both of which were very good.  One has to be patient when dining here as they work at a slow pace in setting the table, time between ordering and receiving the food, time to get the bill, time to reorder drinks.  Fortunately, we were not in a hurry.  But the food was good and the children were treated well, and most importantly the Bloody Mary is only $5!

data.title: Fabulous food
data.text: I have been to the Mason Jar twice and both times I have breakfast. They serve breakfast until 3 pm which I appreciated. The food is very good, fresh, tasty and service is great. It is one of my favorite places to eat and the décor is unique.

data.title: Hope that you like to wait
data.text: Tried this place for the first time for dinner tonight. Got seated quickly, saw a server after about 5 minutes. Took another 5 minutes to get water and at least another 5 minutes to get drinks that were ordered. After placing the dinner order, we waited, ran out of water and soft drinks and waited. Dinner was delivered by someone other than our server. We received no silverware or napkins and when our server wandered by, I asked for silverware and napkins and salt. After at least 5 minutes someone else brought what was requested. WAY TOO MUCH WAITING for things like silverware and napkins. There appeared to be little or no training of the wait staff. Food was good, but nothing to brag about. Overall, disappointed in the place and the prices. When leaving, none of the other staff, including the hostess said "thanks", have a good night or anything. Seems like training of staff to act like they appreciate business is a lost art. Probably won't try it again.

data.title: Just coffee
data.text: This is my third review for cupcake.  We are a group of about 12 who come for coffee at 9:30 one morning a week.  We like to sit in an area with a round table so we can talk.  For the last 5 or six weeks we've been told we must sit near the door.  The tables are small and so we need to group the tables which is awkward.  We've been told the round table is reserved.  No one ever comes to take the table.  Why are they not telling us the truth?  Feeling unwelcome.

data.title: New to me
data.text: We were very impressed. The menu was diverse and splendid. Cocktails were refreshing with a full bar menu. I will be visiting again!

data.title: First visit and wow!
data.text: Definitely will come back again!!!!  Kids meals were unbelievable.  Quality was superb. Cupcakes are overpriced but good.

data.title: Brunch
data.text: This was my 1st visit to The Mason Jar.  I had the MJ omelet.  It has pot roast, caramelized onions and mushrooms inside. Great food, quick sèrvice.
